Posts.Content: anyone taking femara?  I tried Arimadex with bad side effects, weight gain and sever pain in my joints, I already have arthritis, and this just made it unbearable.  I am swithing to femara but just stare at the bottle, I am newly single, as my spouse chose to leave, too much for him I quess, and only 50 so quality of life is a little important for me I am not ready to sleep the rest of my time. any one have any advice.  do you think the benefits of femara will out way the  bad side effects, and will they go away when Im done?  help Im scared......
Posts.Title: side effects of femara

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, I feel for you for I too am in the same place, I am 50 and after 28 years my husband left after the breast  cancer. He stayed through it until 1 year he likes to tell everyone how he stayed by my side thru it but not many know he was never home during it all. He could not handle the attention for one thing that I was getting and it made him mad I was sick .I was diagnoisedi n 2005 and the one great thing I can say about all of this especially him leaving is I have been able to return to God and I do thank him for that and that has been my saving grace for this time. I will keep you in my prayers  be strong. I am a very positive person so if you need to vent or chat email me njwinfrey@yahoo.com   Nancy
Posts.Title: Divorce and Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: On 7/2/2007 Mathnerd wrote: I have been going to the doctor for month for losing weight, my breast getting large all of a sudden (2 sizes), pain shooting down my arm, breast itchy, and overall I just feel bad.  I have been told it is all in my head and what ever it is it is not killing me.  I had a mammogram and hormne testing done and everything comes out normal.  I just heard of IBC, should I go back to the doctor again and have them look for this?  I have been told the same thing by two doctors that some women just have a larger breast.  HELP, I feel like I am going crazy! Please go back and demand tests  maybe a mri or cat, my friend just diagnosed with mastitis and ended up in the er with an unrelated problem a staff infection on her leg then the er Dr. saw her breast and said lets test an she has IBC and extremly bad. please I understand thats a  problem is the miss diagnoises.  please let me know your ok
Posts.Title: IBC
